Text:
Coaxed by Epsilon's enthusiasm, Zeta agrees to guide
her to the Great Ize Shrine, which is said to hold
a clue to the legendary rice cake "Heart's Bounty."

Alright, Zeta. Remember, you're leading me to the
shrine tomorrow.
Yeah, yeah, I know.

(Ugh, what have I gotten myself into this early in
the new year? Oh well, I can't back out of it now...)

Could you not make that exasperated face? I'm going
to pay you back.

Pay me back, huh...? Alright. I'm not expecting
much, though.
Ugh, why do you have to say it like that?

Anyway, I'm counting on you tomorrow. We leave
first thing in the morning, so go to bed early.
Staying up late is bad for your skin.

Mmm...I don't feel like going back to my room,
so I'll just sleep here.

You should sleep in your own room. Do you want to
miss having your first dream of the new year?
"First dream of the new year"?

Yes, it's good luck if you see a mountain, a bird,
and an eggplant in the first dream you have in
the new year.

A mountain, a bird, and an eggplant...? What a
suspiciously random set of things to dream about.

Besides, I'm not the type that believes in luck and
making wishes. There's no guarantee any of it will
work out.
Whatever you say, Zeta. Goodnight then.
Uh-huh, goodnight.
...*yawn* Guess, I'll head back to my room.

..."First dream", huh. Even if I do see mountains
and birds...
For me, I'd rather...

(...Where am I? A grassy meadow? When did I get
here?)
(Huh? Who's that over there?)

â€”and so every year there are old people and children
who choke on it.
But we're still gonna eat it?

Yeah, I know it's dangerous, but it's tradition.
They're just rice cakes.

(Shadow and I when we were kids... Ah, I get it.
I'm dreaming.)

(My face looks so...serious as I hang on Shadow's
every word.)
Wow, you know everything, Master.

Speaking of rice cakes, I'm getting hungry.
Let's head back.
To where everyone else is?
Yeah.

(I look like I don't want to leave. I was so easy to
read.)

Umm, but since we're hungry let's eat somewhere and
then head back.
...Yeah, let's do that.

(Hehe, look at my face. Being with Shadow always
made me so happy.)

A few hours after dawnâ€”when Zeta arrives at the
meeting place, Epsilon is already there.
'Morning. You're here early.

Don't give me that! You're late, very late! I said
we head out first thing in the morning, didn't I?!
Okay, okay, I'm sorry.

What's with that cheerful look on your face?
You don't seem sorry at all.
...I look happy? Hehe, I guess so.

It's rare for you to show emotion. Did something
good happen?

Oh, nothing in particular. Even if there was,
I wouldn't tell you.

True, that's the type of person you are. I won't
press it any further.
So, how was your first dream of the new year?

I...don't remember. I remember having a dream, but I
can't recall what happened...

Even after receiving Shadow Wisdom from Master
Shadow?
Hm? The first dream of the new year is Shadow Wisdom?
Well, of course. I didn't tell you?

No, you didn't. I wish you would've said something,
butâ€”

(...Hehe, I get it now. I think I saw something much
better than a mountain or whatever in my dream.)

...There's that cheerful look again. You must
have had a particularly nice dream, hmm?

Well anyway, we should probably hurry up and get
going. We're going to be late.

Why you...! Who's been waiting on who here? Hmph,
whatever. I'll save my complaints for later. Just
take me to the shrine.
Yeah, yeah, I know. Let's get moving.
W-Wait! What's the big hurry?!
I'm making up for lost time. Keep up with me.
...Hehe, looks like I'm gonna have a good year.

Zeta's eyes crease into a smile as she heads for
the Great Ize Shrineâ€”
